attributes.action: If Parliament Can’t agree on a Brexit Deal the UK Must Leave the EU on WTO Terms
attributes.additional_details:
The British people voted to Leave the EU on the 29th of March 2019, 17,410,742 Million people voted for a WTO Brexit with a Future Relationship Agreement which would entail a U.K-EU Free Trade Agreement & a technological solution to the Irish border.
This deal will deliver on the Conservative manifesto and the 2016 referendum‬.
‪•Leave the Single Market‬
‪•Leave the Customs Union‬
‪•Leave the ECJ so we can Make our own Laws‬
‪•Take Back Control of our Fishing Waters‬
‪•End Freedom Of Movement ‬
attributes.background: It is becoming increasingly likely that Theresa May’s Brexit Deal (Withdrawal Agreement) will be rejected by Parliament. In the event a deal can not be reached, the United Kingdom Must leave the European Union on WTO terms with the future relationship agreement being negotiated at a later date.
